column4: Question - does GNash just work with Flash, or does it work with Shockwave items as well?
Just flash. There is no shockwave plugin for Linux.
yeah, I see that, which is kind of a bummer because I think the educational web based software we have utilize some bits of shockwave.
Yes it does. the ppa is not supported, we don't know what sort of interactions it will have with your system.
no, it did not answer my question. I understand gnome 3 is not supported, but I'm asking about the interactions with XFCE and 11.04, both officially supported.
if anything, perhaps I should ask in Xubuntu. Thanks anyway.
Installing xfce on a stock 11.04 install should not cause any problems. If the gnome3 ppa is installed, I have no idea if it will work or not.
you may want to ask in #clementine if you can't get an answer here.
I have for the last two days. The chat is pretty dead, however I heard a lot of users in here recommending Clementine, so I wanted to try my luck in here again.
Did you look at the links I gave you at all?
oh yes. I'm reading through them now.
just continuing a side conversation, that's all. :)
but make sure that the script itself cannot be edited by that user, only read and executed.
Do you want to list what packages that PPA provides?
basically. We're trying to package the .deb's to a specific PPA as part of our main install here, so if I can get the deb's physically downloaded, I'm golden.
Just grab them from the PPA's launchpad page then.
good thought. I didn't think of that.
appreciate it!
did you run ncdu with sudo?
no... *dupr durp*
err, I forgot, I'm already at the root prompt
so "yes"?
